content:
I cannot predict the future, but it is highly likely that businesses will need to hire specialists to manage their social media presence on emerging platforms, especially if they prove to be successful and gain traction among their target audience.

these specialists may have expertise in the specific platform or niche, as well as experience in social media marketing and digital advertising. they would be responsible for creating and executing a marketing strategy that aligns with the business goals and target audience on the specific platform. this could include creating engaging content, managing paid advertising campaigns, monitoring analytics, and engaging with followers.

however, it is also possible that businesses may not need to hire specialists if the emerging platform is similar in functionality and user behavior to existing social media platforms. in that case, businesses may be able to leverage their existing social media marketing expertise and adapt their strategies to the new platform.

overall, the need for specialists will depend on the complexity of the platform and the business's goals and target audience. it is important for businesses to stay up-to-date on emerging trends and be flexible in their approach to social media marketing to stay ahead of the competition.
